articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader.
articles.title: Hezbollah targets Israeli troops on Lebanese border, sirens in Beirut

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: At least 45 people were killed in Israeli military strikes on Gaza in the past 24 hours, Palestinian medics said on Wednesday, as Israeli forces pressed on with a raid on the Jabalia refugee camp in the enclave's north.
articles.title: Israel carries out new strikes in Gaza, UN chief says many trapped in north

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Andrew Mills
articles.description: The comments come as Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi heads to Saudi Arabia and other Gulf states for talks.
articles.title: Exclusive: Gulf states must not allow use of airspace against Iran, Iranian official says

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: The battle for Erie County, which has voted with the winning presidential candidate for the last four elections, demonstrates the urgency of identifying and contacting individual voters in a campaign that remains stubbornly close.
articles.title: This Pennsylvania county picks presidents. How the Harris vs. Trump fight is going.

articles.author: Greg Torode
articles.description: From a missile discreetly ferried more than 1,000 km (620 miles) to a launch site, to the use of remote bases and satellites to track it from Hainan Island to the South Pacific, China's September ICBM flight marked a test of operational necessity.
articles.title: Beyond the politics, China's missile test reflects military need

articles.author: Lili Bayer
articles.description: Hungary is putting European security at risk, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Wednesday in an unusually blunt speech blasting Budapest’s relationship with Russia and China.
articles.title: EU Commission chief: Hungary's Russia, China policies pose security risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is expected to hold a phone call on Wednesday with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu about any plans to strike Iran, Axios reported late on Tuesday, citing three U.S. officials.
articles.title: Biden to speak to Netanyahu about Iran retaliation on Wednesday, Axios reports

articles.author: Nellie Peyton
articles.description: Voting was underway in Mozambique in a tense general election highly likely to deliver victory for the ruling party, Frelimo, which has governed the southern African nation since 1975.
articles.title: Mozambique votes in election likely to keep ruling party in power

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Southeast Asian leaders met in Laos on Wednesday for a summit expected to find ways of tackling a worsening civil war in Myanmar, with Thailand set to propose a new path for a political solution after a regional peace effort made scant progress.
articles.title: ASEAN holds summit in Laos as Thailand floats new plan for Myanmar crisis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three ethnic Serbs pleaded not guilty in a Kosovo court on Wednesday to terrorism charges in connection with a 2023 shooting attack in which gunmen infiltrating from Serbia stormed a village and shot dead a police officer.
articles.title: Three Serbs plead not guilty over deadly armed group attack in Kosovo
